premises: If a city has good public transportation, then commute times are shorter
A city has good public transportation
incorrect conclusions: Commute times being shorter implies that a city has good public transportation
Commute times not being shorter implies that a city has good public transportation
If a city does not have good public transportation, then commute times are not shorter

premises: If a society values education, then literacy rates are high
incorrect conclusions: High literacy rates imply that a society values education
Low literacy rates imply that a society values education
If a society does not value education, then literacy rates are not high

premises: If there are community support programs, then social cohesion improves
incorrect conclusions: Social cohesion improving implies that there are community support programs
Social cohesion not improving implies that there are community support programs
If there are no community support programs, then social cohesion does not improve
